Public Transport Commute Rate: The ratio of the number of individuals that commute to work by public transportation to the number of households.
Private Vehicle Commute Rate: The ratio of the number of individuals that commute to work by a private vehicle (either alone or carpooled) to the number of households
Walking and Cycling Commute Rate: The ratio of the number of individuals that commute to work by walking or cycling to the number of households
Other Mobility Commute Rate: The ratio of the number of individuals that commute to work by any other means to the number of households
Proportion of Home Owners Not Cost Burde: The percentage of households that are not Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to White, Non-Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Renters Not Cost Burd: The percentage of households that are not Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to White, Non-Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Owners Not Cost Burde: The percentage of households that are not Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to Black or African American, Non-Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Renters Not Cost Burd: The percentage of households that are not Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to Black or African American, Non-Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Owners Not Cost Burde: The percentage of households that are not Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Renters Not Cost Burd: The percentage of households that are not Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Owners That Are Cost: The percentage of households that are Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to White, Non-Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Renters That Are Cost: The percentage of households that are Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to White, Non-Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Owners That Are Cost: The percentage of households that are Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to Black or African American, Non-Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Renters That Are Cost: The percentage of households that are Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to Black or African American, Non-Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Owners That Are Cost: The percentage of households that are Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Renters That Are Cost: The percentage of households that are Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Owners That Are Sever: The percentage of households that are Severely Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to White, Non-Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Renters That Are Seve: The percentage of households that are Severely Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to White, Non-Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Owners That Are Sever: The percentage of households that are Severely Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to Black or African American, Non-Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Renters That Are Seve: The percentage of households that are Severely Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to Black or African American, Non-Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Owners That Are Sever: The percentage of households that are Severely Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to Hispanic residents.
Proportion of Home Renters That Are Seve: The percentage of households that are Severely Cost Burdened. This variant of the metric is specific to Hispanic residents.
Education Rate - No High School Diploma: The ratio of the number of adult residents without a high school diploma to the total number of households.
Education Rate - High School Graduate: The ratio of the number of adult residents with a high school diploma to the total number of households.
Education Rate - Some College or Associa: The ratio of the number of adult residents with some college education or an associate's degree to the total number of households.
Education Rate - Bachelor's Degree or Hi: The ratio of the number of adult residents with a bachelor's degree or higher to the total number of households.
Proportion of Households at Income Level: The percentage of households that fall under the Low Income Level category (Less than $25,000 per year).
The percentage of households that fall under the Middle Income Level category ($25,000 to $50,000 per year).
The percentage of households that fall under the High Income Level category ($50,000 to $100,000 per year).
The percentage of households that fall under the Very High Income Level category (More than $100,000 per year).
Children to Adult Ratio: The ratio of the number of children (age 0-19) to the number of adults (age 20 and over) in the region.
HUD Subsidization Rate: The ratio of HUD subsidized housing units to the total number of occupied housing units.
SNAP Subsidization Rate: The ratio of households receiving SNAP benefits to the total number of occupied housing units.
Occupancy Rate: The percentage of housing units that are occupied.
Overcrowding Rate: The number of overcrowded housing units to the total number of occupied housing units.
